dataset.title: data from fish captured in Arctic Lake NE12

abstract.para: Lengths, weights, sex and otolith data from fish captured in Lake NE12 during the summer of 1986, 1988, and 1989.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

description.para:
Log of changes:
8Feb90. Changed file name from NE12MBL to 89MCNE12. 12Feb90. Changed the data column to conform to paradox standards. Removed ? from wt column. Made site a numeric by removing the ' from quattro file, Changed the fish # to TEXT because of 89 tagging system.

For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: 2Jan90 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Julie Pallant DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: Julie Pallant DATE: 8Feb90, 4Oct91

para.literalLayout: Lake trout were removed from NE12 using five- panel experimental gill nets (mesh size of 3/4, 1, 1 1/2, 2, and 2 1/2 inches). Lengths, weights, and sex were recorded from the fish while otoliths, and if possible, stomachs and gonads were removed for future analysis. Sagital otoliths were mounted in epoxy, thin sectioned through the nucleus and polished using fine grit in the laboratory (similar to Casselman, 1986). Temporary mounts were then made on a glass slide. The otolith section was covered with glycerin, placed under a compound microscope, and total age determined by counting annular rings. Distances between successive annular rings on each otolith were measured using a NIKON MICRO-PLAN II digitizing pad.

Notes: A check was performed on several otoliths by an independent colleague and prevents introduction of bias due to familiarity with the samples. Casselman, J. M. 1986. Age determination of fish from their calcified structures: Refining and improving prodedures. Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources, Fisheries Branch Research Section. Contribution 86-05. 52 pp. This data file is an updated version of a previously released file called "NE12.WK1". This current file, "89MCNE12.WK1" contains all available lake trout otolith data from NE12 collected during the summers of 1986, 1988, and 1989. File "NE12.WK1" is obsolete.

Variable Variable descrip. Precis./Units Coded Missing (Y/N) Values SITE site of measurement y DATE Date DDMMMYY n FISH # fish number n SPECIES LT = lake trout, GR = grayling n TL total length mm n FL fork length mm n SL standard length mm n WT weight grams n STOM stomach taken (y/n) or whole n SEX male or female n MATURE immature of mature n FISH # fish number (again) n AGE age years n TOL total otolith radius mm n DO1..DO52 distance out to annuli from mm n previous annuli COMMENTS notes about data n
